parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post may not be officially sanctioned electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not explicitly mention any parliamentary candidate by name or surname.  The phrase "Arde-i la vot!" ("Burn them at the vote!") is highly suggestive, but lacks specific identification of a target.  This makes it difficult to definitively apply Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post, being a paid Facebook advertisement, is clearly intended to reach a wide audience.  The reach estimate of ">1M" further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The phrase "Arde-i la vot!" is strongly suggestive of an intention to influence voters negatively against unspecified candidates. While not explicitly endorsing or opposing a specific candidate, the call to action implies a clear electoral objective. This potentially satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks any journalistic elements. It does not provide information, analysis, or opinion in a neutral or objective manner. Instead, it uses inflammatory language to incite a reaction from the audience.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion. The use of the imperative "Arde-i la vot!" ("Burn them at the vote!") indicates a deliberate attempt to influence voters, not simply express a personal view.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1252234892751479</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning a specific candidate, uses inflammatory language ("Arde-i la vot!") with the clear intention to influence voters negatively against unspecified candidates.  The paid nature of the Facebook advertisement, targeting a large audience, further strengthens the argument that this constitutes electoral propaganda.  The lack of a CMF number weakens the case, but the strong call to action and inflammatory nature of the message outweigh this factor.  The post's ambiguity regarding the target candidates makes a definitive conclusion challenging, but the potential for influencing the election outcome is significant.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Unspecified</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Claudiu-Iorga Palaz, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 1252234892751479, care conține mesajul inflamator „Arde-i la vot!”, având ca efect electoral influențarea negativă a votului împotriva unor candidați nespecificați, dar vizibil direcționat către electorat,  printr-o campanie plătită pe Facebook cu o estimare a audienței de peste 1 milion de persoane,  și cu cheltuieli sub 100 RON, conform datelor din Ad Library.  Contactul advertiserului este miscareapopulara.constanta@gmail.com și +40720888888.  Lipsa unui număr CMF nu exonerează de răspundere, având în vedere caracterul evident electoral al mesajului și intenția clară de a influența votul.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
